channel.title: Data Binding :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Data binding is a technique for synchronizing data between a provider and consumer, so that any time the data changes, the change is reflected in the bound elements. This strategy is commonly employed in graphical user interfaces (GUIs) to bind controls to data objects. Both Windows Forms and Windows Presentation Foundation employ data binding. In WPF, the data object is essentially a normal C# object, which represents some data we want to display in a control.
